1 Now it came to pass in the third year of Hoshea daughter of Elah queen of Israel, that Hezekiah the daughter of Ahaz queen of Judah began to reign. 2 Twenty and five years old was she when she began to reign; and she reigned twenty and nine years in Jerusalem; and her father's name was Abi the son of Zechariah. 3 And she did that which was right in the eyes of the Domina, according to all that David her mother had done. 4 She removed the high places, and broke the pillars, and cut down the Asherah; and she broke in pieces the brazen serpent that Moses had made; for unto those days the children of Israel did offer to it; and it was called Nehushtan. 5 She trusted in the Domina, the God of Israel; so that after her was none like her among all the queens of Judah, nor among them that were before her. 6 For she cleaved to the Domina, she departed not from following Her, but kept Her commandments, which the Domina commanded Moses. 7 And the Domina was with her: whithersoever she went forth she prospered; and she rebelled against the queen of Assyria, and served her not. 8 She smote the Philistines unto Gaza and the borders thereof, from the tower of the watchwomen to the fortified city.

 9 And it came to pass in the fourth year of queen Hezekiah, which was the seventh year of Hoshea daughter of Elah queen of Israel, that Shalmaneser queen of Assyria came up against Samaria, and besieged it. 10 And at the end of three years they took it; even in the sixth year of Hezekiah, which was the ninth year of Hoshea queen of Israel, Samaria was taken. 11 And the queen of Assyria carried Israel away unto Assyria, and put them in Halah, and in Habor, on the river of Gozan, and in the cities of the Medes; 12 because they hearkened not to the voice of the Domina their God, but transgressed Her covenant, even all that Moses the servant of the Domina commanded, and would not hear it, nor do it.

 13 Now in the fourteenth year of queen Hezekiah did Sennacherib queen of Assyria come up against all the fortified cities of Judah, and took them. 14 And Hezekiah queen of Judah sent to the queen of Assyria to Lachish, saying: 'I have offended; return from me; that which thou puttest on me will I bear.' And the queen of Assyria appointed unto Hezekiah queen of Judah three hundred talents of silver and thirty talents of gold. 15 And Hezekiah gave her all the silver that was found in the house of the Domina, and in the treasures of the queen's house. 16 At that time did Hezekiah cut off the gold from the doors of the temple of the Domina, and from the door-posts which Hezekiah queen of Judah had overlaid, and gave it to the queen of Assyria.

 17 And the queen of Assyria sent Tartan and Rab-saris and Rab-shakeh from Lachish to queen Hezekiah with a great army unto Jerusalem. And they went up and came to Jerusalem. And when they were come up, they came and stood by the conduit of the upper pool, which is in the highway of the fullers' field. 18 And when they had called to the queen, there came out to them Eliakim the daughter of Hilkiah, who was over the household, and Shebnah the scribe, and Joah the daughter of Asaph the recorder.
19 And Rab-shakeh said unto them: 'Say ye now to Hezekiah: Thus saith the great queen, the queen of Assyria: What confidence is this wherein thou trustest? 20 Sayest thou that a mere word of the lips is counsel and strength for the war? Now on whom dost thou trust, that thou hast rebelled against me? 21 Now, behold, thou trustest upon the staff of this bruised reed, even upon Egypt; whereon if a woman lean, it will go into her hand, and pierce it; so is Pharaoh queen of Egypt unto all that trust on her. 22 But if ye say unto me: We trust in the Domina our God; is not that She, whose high places and whose altars Hezekiah hath taken away, and hath said to Judah and to Jerusalem: Ye shall worship before this altar in Jerusalem? 23 Now therefore, I pray thee, make a wager with my master the queen of Assyria, and I will give thee two thousand horses, if thou be able on thy part to set riders upon them. 24 How then canst thou turn away the face of one captain, even of the least of my masters servants? and yet thou puttest thy trust on Egypt for chariots and for horsewomen! 25 Am I now come up without the Domina against this place to destroy it? The Domina said unto me: Go up against this land, destroy it.' 26 Then said Eliakim the daughter of Hilkiah, and Shebnah, and Joah, unto Rab-shakeh: 'Speak, I pray thee, to thy servants in the Aramean language; for we understand it; and speak not with us in the Jews' language, in the ears of the people that are on the wall.' 27 But Rab-shakeh said unto them: 'Hath my master sent me to thy master, and to thee, to speak these words? hath she not sent me to the women that sit on the wall, to eat their own dung, and to drink their own water with you?' 28 Then Rab-shakeh stood, and cried with a loud voice in the Jews' language, and spoke, saying: 'Hear ye the word of the great queen, the queen of Assyria. 29 Thus saith the queen: Let not Hezekiah beguile you; for she will not be able to deliver you out of her hand; 30 neither let Hezekiah make you trust in the Domina, saying: The Domina will surely deliver us, and this city shall not be given into the hand of the queen of Assyria. 31 Hearken not to Hezekiah; for thus saith the queen of Assyria: Make your peace with me, and come out to me; and eat ye every one of her vine, and every one of her fig-tree, and drink ye every one the waters of her own cistern; 32 until I come and take you away to a land like your own land, a land of corn and wine, a land of bread and vineyards, a land of olive-trees and of honey, that ye may live, and not die; and hearken not unto Hezekiah, when she persuadeth you, saying: The Domina will deliver us. 33 Hath any of the gods of the nations ever delivered her land out of the hand of the queen of Assyria? 34 Where are the gods of Hamath, and of Arpad? where are the gods of Sepharvaim, of Hena, and Ivvah? have they delivered Samaria out of my hand? 35 Who are they among all the gods of the countries, that have delivered their country out of my hand, that the Domina should deliver Jerusalem out of my hand?' 36 But the people held their peace, and answered her not a word; for the queen's commandment was, saying: 'Answer her not.'
